modules.description: This module implements the Oklab color space, providing functions to create colors using perceptual parameters and convert them to and from the `Color.gg` format or CSS strings. It operates on a custom `t` type representing colors in Oklab space, with components stored as floats. Concrete use cases include generating smooth color gradients and converting colors for display in web contexts using `to_css`.

This module implements the Oklch color space, providing functions to create colors using lightness, chroma, and hue parameters. It supports conversion to and from the `gg` color format and can output colors as CSS strings. Use it to manipulate colors in a perceptually uniform space ideal for gradients, theme generation, or UI color adjustments.

This module implements color manipulation using the HSL (Hue, Saturation, Lightness) color model. It provides functions to construct HSL colors with optional transparency, convert them to and from the `gg` color format, and generate CSS-compatible string representations. It directly works with floating-point values for hue, saturation, lightness, and alpha, making it suitable for applications like UI design tools or visualizations where perceptual color adjustments are needed.

This module represents colors in the RGB color space using floating-point values for red, green, blue, and optional alpha channels. It provides functions to construct RGB colors, convert them to and from a generic color type (`gg`), and serialize them into CSS-compatible string representations. Use this module when working with RGB colors in contexts requiring high precision, such as graphics rendering or color interpolation.

This module implements RGB color creation with optional transparency and conversion to CSS string format. It operates on RGB values represented as integers, with an optional float alpha channel. Typical use cases include generating screen colors for display or converting colors to web-compatible CSS strings.

This library provides color conversion between RGB, HSL, Oklab, and Oklch color spaces, along with utilities for adjusting visual properties like hue, lightness, and chroma. It operates on color representations including integer/float-based RGB and the abstract `Color.gg` type, supporting tasks like contrast ratio calculation, readability analysis for text-background pairs, and perceptually balanced random color generation. Specific applications include UI theme design, accessibility compliance for color contrast, and algorithmic color manipulation in graphics workflows.
